citation.article-title: Sulfuricurvum kujiense gen. nov., sp. nov., a facultatively anaerobic, chemolithoautotrophic, sulfur-oxidizing bacterium isolated from an underground crude-oil storage cavity.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Sulfuricurvum (Sul.fu.ri.cur′vum. L. neut. n. sulfur -uris sulfur; L. adj. curvus -a -um curved; N.L. neut. n. Sulfuricurvum curved bacterium that utilizes sulfur).
Chemolithoautotrophic and sulfur-oxidizing, capable of thriving under microaerobic and anaerobic conditions.
Based on 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, it represents a new lineage in the ‘Epsilonproteobacteria’.
The sole and type species is Sulfuricurvum kujiense.
